item.description:
CANCELLED AS THE MILLYARD MUSEUM IS CLOSED DUE TO FLOODING

“Tracing Lincoln’s Footsteps” Walking Tour
Wednesday, June 9, 2010
Starting at the Millyard Museum
5:30 p.m.-7:30 p.m.
$5 Manchester Historic Association members; $10 general public
Pre-registration is required.

Abraham Lincoln visited Manchester 150 years ago, on March 1 and 2, 1860. This tour, conducted by MHA staff, will trace his steps as he disembarked the train, gave an important speech in Smyth Hall, spent the night in a hotel on Elm Street, and toured the Millyard the next morning. Several buildings that Lincoln would have seen or entered will be pointed out. The tour leaders will read excerpts of accounts of Lincoln's memorable visit. The program will begin with a short orientation in the special exhibit "Abraham Lincoln: Manchester Remembers."

This tour will be repeated on Sunday, June 27.
item.name: "Tracing Lincoln's Footsteps" Walking Tour - CANCELLED
